user_query: for the Trope of main character getting forced to raise and be annoyed by a child who ends up changing the mean character's outlook on life one of my top 10 cliches 6 out of 10 for the story and emotion I was of course surprised Pete Davidson did really well voice acting Petey I would pay money to hear his sigh of relief getting this role after doing the atrocity that was Marmaduke I'm going to be a champion too at first through trailers I didn't think he had a silly enough voice to capture the over-the-top Petey energy nor did I think his voice fit the character design I pictured more of a Bill Cipher or Zach Galifianakis Joker type of voice and either it's just Pete Davidson's monotone voice but it comes off very obvious he's reading the script with most of his voice roles and I didn't know how he was going to get past that especially when given lines like I need to stop this super cop but he actually stole the spotlight in this film and at the end of the day I think Pete Davidson's rougher voice added this element of connectability to Petey's character that we wouldn't have gotten with an overly cartoonish villain voice and I've realized through watching this movie that I should not be a casting director DreamWorks knew what they were doing casting him the movie portrays Petey as more of a doofus who still has a soul deep down type villain and Pete Davidson fit that to a tee this role is to Pete Davidson what Emmett is to Chris Pratt you're a cloned cat sitting in a
